title: Why we should welcome the end of shopping around for the cheapest insurance
text:
The way we buy home and car insurance is, by any standards, utterly bonkers and totally opaque. Finally some sanity could be introduced into this system, though it will cause short-term pain for many.

When insurance is taken out, the premium paid is normally discounted to entice customers to sign up. Insurers then make their money back by raising the cost every year hoping apathy kicks in.

These companies do not have to explain the calculations behind their quotes, so there is no way of knowing if any increase to renewal premiums is fair or a money-grabbing exercise.

In this topsy-turvy world, the only way to benefit is to shop around every year, ensuring constant access to discounted insurance. ...
